column5: Im a big S&G fan, and that new version is sweet.
There gonna be in niagara falls next week, (rapids theater, but sold out).....theres a chance theyll be playing this live.
I like it, but not as much as the original,
Same here, I prefer the original but this one's not bad.
Man, that man has a set of pipes! Thanks for the link! HH
Same here, I prefer the original but this one's not bad.  Ditto. A good cover, but it's still a cover.
Loved it just as much as the original.
Wow!  As both an S&G ad disturbed fan, that was great! Thanks for sharing.
Liking that as much as the original !!!
Just watched this off of Conan.  Live is awesome.

just had to make me listen to it again didn't you I really did not want to like it I consider Paul Simon more then just  a singer song writer hes a poet and a story teller and more he wrote that song in the 60s when folk music was in and the way to tell a story I loved the song this now has a harder edge to the song and damn it ,it was done every well so I guess Im saying I like it

just had to make me listen to it again didn't you I really did not want to like it I consider Paul Simon more then just  a singer song writer hes a poet and a story teller and more he wrote that song in the 60s when folk music was in and the way to tell a story I loved the song this now has a harder edge to the song and damn it ,it was done every well so I guess Im saying I like it  I dont disagree at all, like I said, big S&G fan . but this guys voice kills it. I think of all songs that have been redone, this one is right at the top.  Wonder if he can do an Elvis song?

Live version is even better than the recorded one!  I'm liking David dramains new direction in music (second band to Disturbed called device) and this.  I saw them in 2012 at HeavyMTL and I will be seeing them again this summer at the same festival, should be good!
Just listened to different parts of it and didn't care for it all. All the same monotone and too slow. I still have the 45, and the flac album. But to each their own eh.  Cheers
The live version is better and it is very well done. But........... come on
